content.text:
# Malludawara

| footnotes               =
}}
Malludawara is a village in Batala in Gurdaspur district of Punjab State, India. It is located  from sub district headquarter,  from district headquarter and  from Sri Hargobindpur. The village is administrated by Sarpanch an elected representative of the village.
Demography
, the village has a total number of 91 houses and a population of 533 of which 281 are males while 252 are females.  According to the report published by Census India in 2011, out of the total population of the village 96 people are from Schedule Caste and the village does not have any Schedule Tribe population so far.

*List of villages in India
